gurmukhi: supn cirqR icqR jwgq n dyKIAq qwrkw mMfl prBwiq n idKweIAY
transliteration: Soupan Charitr Chitr Jaagat N Daykheeata , Taarakaa Mandal Parabhaati N Dikhaaeeai ?
translation: Just as dream events cannot be seen while awake, just as stars are not visible after sunrise;

gurmukhi: qrvr CwieAw lGu dIrG cpl bl qIrQ purb jwqRw iQr n rhweIAY
transliteration: Taravar Chhaaiaa Laghu Deeragh Chapal Bala , Teerad Purab Jaatraa Dir N Rahaaeeai ?
translation: Just as the shadow of a tree keeps changing in size with the falling rays of the sun; and the pilgrimage to the holy places does not last for ever.

gurmukhi: ndI nwv ko sMjog log bhuirE n imlY gMDRb ngr miRg qiRsnw iblweIAY
transliteration: Nadee Naav Ko Sanjog Log Bahuriao N Milai , Gandhrab Nagar Mrig Trisanaa Bilaaeeai ?
translation: As the fellow travellers of a boat do not get to travel together again, as the presence of water due to mirage or the imaginary abode of gods (in space) is an illusion.

gurmukhi: qYsy mwieAY moh DRoh kutMb snyh dyh gurmuiK sbd suriq ilv lweIAY ]117]
transliteration: Taisay Maaiai Moh Dhroh Koutanb Sanayh Dayha , Gurmukhi Sabad Surati Liv Laaeeai ?117?
translation: So does a Guru-conscious person regards mammon, attachment and love of the body an illusion and he keeps his consciousness focused on the divine word of the Guru. (117)
